Ginko The company

At Ginko, we are Digital specialists, and only Digital!
Why ? Because 100% of our Business Managers come from digital professions.
This has been our focus since the beginning: Business Managers, competent and trained in our professions, able to understand the real problems of our customers and the expectations of our consultants.
Our business-oriented approach and our technical know-how on Network-Systems infrastructures, Cloud Computing and Artificial Intelligence are essential elements for advising and supporting our clients on all of their transformation projects.
We are looking for strong, competent personalities with varied backgrounds who challenge each other. What we want even more are people who, like us:
find that Bernard Madoff's Ponzi pyramid is a bit committed...
would have claimed “I slipped chief! » in place of Jérôme Kerviel…
know that “Data Driven” is not a video game…
don't need C3PO to understand R2D2...

Job Description

As a Data Engineer, you will bring your expertise and skills to our teams to build the technical solutions expected by our partners. Within an innovative DSI, you will be responsible for:
Analyze and control the quality of the data received from our client's IS;
Implement new functionalities in the data ingestion / transformation processes within the Hadoop cluster, develop the feed flows / database modeling;
Identify and test new Hadoop stack modules;
Manage high volumes / multi-run;
Collaborate with Sata Scientists for the industrialization of Machine Learning algorithms (clustering, recommendation, etc.);
Perform IT / TNR tests, run MEP and run support on deployed modules;
Perform technology watch on the Big Data ecosystem;
Write technical specifications.

Required profile

You have a Bac +5 training in computer science as well as an experience of at least 2 years on a similar position.
You perfectly master Hadoop
Big Query, Dataflow, Python, Pubsub, Composer, Terraform and Stackdriver no longer hold any secrets for you.

You are able to express yourself in English both orally and in writing. Data Engineer Hadoop F/H La Défense (92) As a Data Engineer, you will bring your expertise and skills to our teams to build the technical solutions expected by our partners.

Nexity Company Description

1st platform of real estate services in France, we are close to the daily life of our customers, partners and our employees, who are our greatest wealth.
Joining Nexity means being part of a Group where the commitment and well-being of employees are at the heart of the HR strategy!
Joining Nexity means leaving your mark on the city! Come, you too, to create value for our customers through one of our 200 promotion and service professions for individuals, companies, communities and institutions.
Convinced that human capital and the diversity of profiles are both a strength and the first asset for a committed company,
Nexity pursues a proactive policy of inclusion, particularly in terms of recruitment. This is why Nexity promotes and acts concretely in favor of diversity, gender balance and equity. Don't wait any longer, join us!

Job Description

Attached to the digital commerce marketing department, you will join the Data team, a team of around fifteen employees bringing together both technical and functional expertise around all of the Nexity group's data (Data Engineer, Data Analyst and Data Scientist ). You will be supervised by the Lead Data Scientist.
You will be required to work on a variety of issues:
¤ Preparation, exploitation and exploration of all data lake data sources
¤ Creation of decision support reports for the Marketing and Commerce department and other Nexity departments
¤ Participate in the implementation of elaborate Dashboards
Participate in the operational excellence of the CRC (Call Center):
¤ You participate in the realization of targeting extraction for telephone campaigns
¤ You participate in high value projects for the CRC to help them improve their conversion performance
¤ You will work closely with the CRC teams and the rest of the Data team
Understand, analyze and extract data on the various Nexity businesses:
¤ You participate in the production of extraction and reporting (PowerBI and Tableau Software)
¤ You master the technical and functional aspects of Nexity data in order to perform these extractions
¤ You will be in direct contact with end users
¤ You will demonstrate an analytical mind and be proactive in building new business indicators
By joining Nexity you will have the opportunity to….
¤ Be autonomous, actor of the valuation of the data at the service of the business and see the impact of your actions on the turnover of the group.
¤ Be part of an autonomous Data team in the collection, processing and deployment of data subjects. A team made up of 2 data Engineers, 1 data Scientist, 2 data Analysts
¤ Work on the most advanced tools and technologies (Dataiku, Tableau Software, AWS environment)
¤ Integrate a digital marketing team, young and transverse.
¤ Participate in the transformation of a group that is a leader in its sector and in full growth (+14% to 2021)…. In the heart of Paris.

Qualifications

¤ Training at Bac+3 / Bac+5 level with a specialization in data analysis/statistics (Licence Pro, IUT, School of Engineering, Specialized Master)
¤ Have a good foundation in data analysis
¤ Mastery of SQL language and query tools to provide analyzes according to requests
¤ Mastery of data analysis and statistical methodologies
¤ Knowledge of R and/or python is appreciated
¤ Sensitivity to data visualization
¤ Good analytical skills, enthusiastic and eager to learn
¤ Communicating, able to transmit and promote its activity

Additional Information

Discover our Digital and IT environment as well as all our similar offers via our space available on Welcome To The Jungle! Data Analyst Junior (F/H) - CDI Paris 8e (75) A team made up of 2 data Engineers, 1 data Scientist, 2 data Analysts.
¤ Be part of an autonomous Data team in the collection, processing and...

42c Who are we ?
In agile mode, we provide answers to the expectations of our customers and we support them in the success of their projects.
42c is an IT consulting and expertise firm.
In the cloud, data, cybersecurity or digital transformation, our long-term team is recognized as a technical and functional pillar. She is an expert in many business sectors such as banking and insurance, media, telecoms, or industry.
We also provide specific business support for the finance and media sectors.
Between our lab, our internal school and our partnerships, we monitor and improve the skills of our employees.
With more than 1,000 projects successfully completed, we provide our partners with proven solutions adapted to their challenges.
We make their satisfaction our priority.
42c: a unique history, strong teams and historical customers.
Your missions
Integrated within our teams at one of our customers, you will participate in the different phases of information system overhaul or development projects:
Establishment and maintenance of a robust infrastructure
Integration of data flows in the datalake
Verification of integration constraints (real time and/or batch)
Data optimization and consolidation for businesses
Optimization of the database in order to guarantee the smooth running of requests
And if it were you ?
You come from an engineering school or university equivalent (bac+5 level) and you ideally benefit from 3 years of experience thanks to which you have acquired solid skills:
When it comes to Python, Scala, Spark development
On Big Data platforms (Cloudera, HortonWorks, etc.)
On managing SQL/NoSQL databases.
CDI contract
Start date: As soon as possible
Location: Paris – Portes de Lilas
Contact :
Mrs. Miriam Ouraghi, Recruitment Manager
recruitment@42c.fr Data Engineer H/F Paris (75) In the cloud, data, cybersecurity or digital transformation, our long-term team is recognized as a technical and functional pillar.

RS2i Who are we ?
At RS2i, we are committed to achieving your digital transformation, thanks to our long-standing expertise.
Specialist in computer engineering and integrator of software solutions recognized for 30 years, RS2i supports its customers in all stages of their projects: from design to development, including support and advice.
Our areas of expertise are process modeling & optimization (BPM/ESB), media content management & dematerialization, implementation of management software packages and publishing of BI & Big Data solutions.
Context of the mission
We are recruiting a Data Consultant / Data Engineer who will evolve within a Data & Analytics environment, a DevOps culture and contexts operating in Agile mode.
As a Data Consultant, you work on business issues around data management. In collaboration with data architects, data analysts, DevSecOps, infra and cloud teams, you will be required to set up data solutions and platforms (datahub, datalake, streaming platform, event-driven pipeline, etc.), develop, deploy and maintain data transformation chains.
The golden rule: collection and integration, storage, processing and storage, availability for analysis and reporting.

You master java, python and/or scala and have significant experience on a data project. True follower of devops and cloud practices, mastery of kafka would be an asset.
Profile required
BAC+5 of the Engineering School or University type,
Curious by nature with a thirst for learning,
Ability to adapt and work in a team,
Good technical and interpersonal skills,
Be a force for proposing technically innovative and reliable solutions. Data Engineer F/H Levallois-Perret (92) You master java, python and/or scala and have significant experience on a data project.
A true follower of devops and cloud practices, the mastery of…

McKinsey & Company Who You'll Work With
Based in Paris and working across the region, as a consultant data engineer you will work closely with our clients, data scientists and all types of McKinsey consultants to curate problem specific datasets that feed directly into our machine learning and modeling approach.
This hybrid client-facing/technical role will allow you to use state of the art technologies to solve highly impactful business problems, whilst also leveraging your strong communication skills to convey complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
who you are
This position is for a data engineer (all seniority levels) with strong intrinsic technical ability and an aptitude for solving complex problems using technology.
A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.
What You'll Do
As a Data Engineer with the Paris office...
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.
See our video: A Day in the Life of a Data Engineer
Role responsibilities
Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches
Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms
Understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape.
Maintaining our Information Security standards on the engagement.
Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models.
Defining the technology stack to be provisioned by our infrastructure team.
Building modular pipeline to construct features and modeling tables.
Use new and creative techniques to deliver impact for our clients as well as internal R&D projects.
What you'll learn
No project is ever the same – we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities across the region.
How successful projects on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end pipelines.
Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations.
Be focused on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data by working alongside the Data Science team which focuses on modeling the data.
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment.
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programs at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognize the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.
Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimizing a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:
Healthcare Efficiency – We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagn Data Engineer (full time, all seniority levels) - QuantumBla... 75008 Paris Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches.
Fluency in both English and French.

Heaviside At Heaviside we partner with organizations to design data-augmented strategies, engineer pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problem.
We step-function business by inventing their future way of working. We do this by designing data-augmented strategies, engineering pragmatic technologies and delivering impactful use-cases that enlighten real-world problems.
All roles at Heaviside involve business and technical development pathways which aim at facilitating your career growth. We aspire to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career which will have a greater impact.
As a Data Engineer at Heaviside, you will be joining a small team responsible for the data systems that power everything we do for our clients. It can cover both strategy and business planning as well as cutting-edge behavioral research and organizational analytics.
You will be responsible for the end-to-end implementation of the data stack from collection to reporting, with a focus on infrastructure and technical processes.
You will be working with Data Consultants and support them in tackling their clients' data challenges. You will contribute to the definition of data strategies, the implementation of data systems, and you will support the leverage of data into transformational projects.
In general, you will be responsible for understanding problems intimately, crafting a technical strategy to address them, and facilitating high-quality technical execution.
Responsibilities
Data Unifier: Architect, assemble, assimilate, clean, and conform large, complex datasets to deliver business insights and power data product experiences
Data Security Agent: Design and build reliable, scalable data infrastructure with leading privacy and security techniques to safeguard data
Data Ops: Own the end-to-end data stack including event collection, data governance, data integrations, and modeling
Data Custodian: Ensure consistency and quality of the technical environment and data structure through metrics, documentation, processes, data testing, and training
If you have some or all of the following please apply
Knowledgeable in Cloud Data Warehouse services. Experience in Google BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS Redshift/Athena, Looker, Azure SQL DWH or Azure Databricks is highly desirable
Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modeling, data optimization and data analysis techniques
Experience in building end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud-based data platforms
Experience with hands-on delivery of solutions which include databases, advanced SQL and software development in languages ​​such as Python
Interested and knowledgeable in Big Data technologies and Apache ecosystem technologies such as Beam, Spark, Kafka, Airflow, databases, integration, master data management, quality assurance, data wrangling and data governance technologies
Experienced with public cloud platforms and cloud infrastructure, which is essential
Exposed to ETL/ELT and governance tools
Interested in AI and ML technologies and principles
Able to migrate and transform large, complex datasets from various sources, structures and formats, modeled to support analysis for access to quality actionable insights
You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver with thought leadership and commercial awareness
You are fully fluent in French and English (the position is based in Paris)
Benefits
At Heaviside, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts by providing benefits that allow our employees:
You will benefit from a competitive package based on your experience with opportunity for advancement
We are committed to make you grow and become the best version of yourself as part of a world-class team with bright and passionate people. Heaviside will strongly invest in your development through on-going training and personalized skills development path
We value initiative and are always happy to grant team building activities or any kind of insightful training
There is no subject matter expert at Heaviside, even if our consultants start their track with a strategic/business or tech “color”, they are expected to build or strengthen their expertise or consulting approach during client assignments
Our HR and Staffing team is closely following each individual in order to make everyone the best version of himself
Inclusion & Diversity
The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Heaviside. Data Engineer Paris (75) Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modeling, data optimization and data analysis techniques.

Numberly Company Description

Numberly puts technology to work for marketing: we help our clients better understand their consumers by implementing systems to collect, analyze and use data. For this, we are more than 150 engineers (a third of Numberly) divided into autonomous teams.
We want everyone to be able to develop a positive influence, be proactive, and question our technical or organizational choices.

Job Description

You are involved in all phases from the design to the implementation of decision support and performance monitoring tool applications responding to the business issues of our customers.
You are led to:
Intervene on missions of framing and analysis of functional needs;
Identify and propose the right KPIs to meet customer expectations;
Design and produce decision support reports with attention to self BI issues, as well as to UX/UI Desktop and mobile;
Deploy Data Visualization projects under PowerBI as a priority but possibly by participating in the choice of other restitution tools;
Support customers in understanding and building skills in the operation and maintenance of dashboards.
You will also ensure a technological watch, and will propose standardized, reliable, scalable solutions related to your activity.

Qualifications

You have at least 2 years of experience in setting up datawarehouse and datamart projects.
You have a particular appetite for the field of Big Data, with achievements of BI/reporting and dataviz projects in this context;
You have good knowledge on the subjects and skills on the following technologies: ETL and SQL.
You are curious, autonomous, force of proposal and have the team spirit.
You have a sense of contact and a strong motivation to work in an innovative and dynamic environment (numerous prizes have been awarded to Numberly's work in Europe and the USA) within a young team (27 years old on average) and international (25 nationalities).
Even better if
You have experience with PowerBI.
You have knowledge of the functional area of ​​marketing, digital, CRM, media and customer relations.

Additional Information

At Numberly, we share a passion for transmission: weekly seminars, talks with expert professionals in their field, continuous learning.
Fast and powerful onboarding, in particular thanks to:
Jedi Masters awarded to new recruits;
to Live my life in different teams;
at the Happy Meetings attended by all the teams around the world to share the group's news.
We cultivate freedom of speech which allows everyone to participate in the influence of the group. Through 1000mercis impacts but also through our activities that create value in the open Internet, we act positively on our ecosystem.
Numberly is Gender Equal by design (women/men equality index of 97/100 in 2020, WeConnect International certification).
Numberly is an international environment (you interact with many nationalities on a daily basis) where you feel at home: offices in our image, friendly kitchens, a cutting-edge library, a large fully equipped music studio, space for bicycles. Unlimited coffee, tea and herbal teas. Mystery lunches, costume parties and sports lessons.
Possibility of being remote up to 50% of your time (to be organized as you wish).
Swile card (meal vouchers).
Position available in Paris.
Numberly welcomes candidates with disabilities. BI Engineer & Data Visualisation 75009 Paris 9e For this, we are more than 150 engineers (a third of Numberly) divided into autonomous teams.
Intervene on missions of framing and analysis of…

Carrefour The use of data and the development of analytical capabilities are a major focus of the Group's strategic plan for 2027. Directly attached to COMEX France, Carrefour France's Analytics Factory is the pillar of this analytical transformation, serving the All of Carrefour France's business teams – Marketing, Merchandise, Operations, E-commerce, Supply Chain, Financial Services, etc.

The management's data scientists, data engineers, data viz and data governance specialists support the business teams on a daily basis to improve operational excellence (process automation, democratization of access to data, development of the analytical culture), to optimize the offer and the customer experience on our sites and in our stores (assortments, promotion, personalization, forecasts, ...) and to help with strategic planning and decision-making.
Carrefour is looking for its Data & Analytics France Department based in Massy (91), a
Data engineer (M/F)

About the position
We use machine learning approaches to solve commercial and operational challenges such as in-store shortages, sales forecasting, optimization of product assortment, personalization of the experience on the carrefour.fr site
As a data engineer, you will build robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning solutions.
You will be attentive to the choice of the right tools and architectural diagrams in order to improve the performance of the systems and to facilitate their monitoring and maintenance.
As a member of our agile community of engineers, you will iteratively contribute to projects and conduct code reviews. You will also describe the infrastructure of our systems in code form.
Within feature teams, you will work daily with Data Scientists, Data Translators and Data Analysts. You will also interact with different Carrefour teams, in particular to integrate new data sources, to connect our solutions to different information systems, or to give them access to new data created by the lab.
Thanks to your incremental knowledge of Carrefour data, you will play a key role in the success of the Lab. Your expertise will also be essential at each stage of the projects: qualification, MVP, continuous integration, monitoring of the solution in production.
As a Data Engineer, you will report to the tech lead of the data science division, and will be guided by a Lead Data Scientist within your feature team.
About you
You have a degree in computer science at least at master's level, or you have equivalent professional experience.
After at least 2 years of professional experience as a Data Engineer, you have developed expertise in:
data manipulation with scripts (SQL) and code (Python)
the construction and operation of data pipelines on cloud infrastructures
the use of distributed computing frameworks
You enjoy exploring new datasets, transforming them, cleaning them and enriching them in order to make them usable.
You have taken part in collaborative development projects, and the quality and simplicity of the code are important to you.
You enjoy working with colleagues from different backgrounds, and it is pleasant to work with you on a day-to-day basis!
Thanks to excellent interpersonal and communication skills, you are able to communicate your complex ideas to various non-technical audiences.
You have a fluent command of French, and a minimum of technical English.

The little extras
We appreciate any experience building apps on GCP.
Your DevOps knowledge and experience (CI/CD process, containerization, ...) will also be valuable to us.
Machine learning being at the heart of our lab's mission, your knowledge and curiosity on this subject will be welcome!


CDI position based in Massy. Status frame Data Engineer H/F 91300 Massy As a data engineer, you will build robust and scalable data processing systems to industrialize our machine learning solutions.

MP DATA Passionate about the growth of tomorrow's mobility?
Join our team of experts in data/AI applied to the field of transport of the future (more than twenty use cases!).
MP DATA is a team of 70 Data Experts (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Architects, ML Engineers) who support the largest French groups on highly innovative AI projects.
We are recruiting a Data Scientist (M/F) to work on the development of new Data-driven transport networks.
As part of its strong growth, MP DATA is recruiting a Data Scientist NLP (M/F) to work more specifically on topics related to automatic language processing.
As such, your missions as an NLP Data Scientist will be as follows:
Understand and formalize the use cases of our customers
Preparing textual data for use
Propose NLP models
Deliver an industrial version
With a Grande Ecole Engineer profile (Mines, SupAéro, INSA, Centrale, etc.),* you have a first professional experience in NLP (Spacy, NLTK, Hugging Face)*. Cloud skills (AWS, GCP, Azure) are a plus.
In any case, you are passionate about data and tech.
You are recognized for your autonomy, your sense of a job well done and your ability to take initiatives.
You want to propel your career in AI and Data!
Type of employment: Full time, CDI
Status frame
Salary: €38,000.00 to €60,000.00 per year
Advantages :
Participation in Transportation
RTT
Meal voucher

From Monday to Friday

SESAMm Who are we ?
SESAMm is the French leader in alternative data and Artificial Intelligence solutions applied to asset management (www.sesamm.com).
We are specialized in the creation of innovative analytics and alternative data: we analyze in real time billions of messages, articles and posts from several million data sources.
Team: more than 70 people, mainly engineers and researchers
Offices: Paris, New York, Tokyo, London, Tunis & Metz
International clientele made up of large accounts, including asset managers, hedge funds and major banks in North America, Asia and Europe.
Key technologies: Natural Language Processing, Big Data, Machine Learning and Quantitative Analysis
Join SESAMm, an innovative and fast-growing Fintech!
Why are we looking for a Data Engineer today?
Are you looking for a new challenge?
Do you dream of supporting a growing company, proposing new ideas, implementing new tools and developing processes?
At SESAMm, everyone brings their creativity, ideas and skills, we are all experts and beginners at the same time. We promote proximity, mutual aid and teamwork.
We learn every day from the experience of this great team and we are constantly taking on new challenges. We are proud of the work accomplished and of participating in the success of this great adventure!
In short: As a Data Engineer, you will be called upon to participate in the daily life of the team as well as to accompany us throughout our various projects.
Your daily life:
Participation in the conceptualization and implementation of a new product
Development and maintenance of Big Data calculation algorithms with the rest of the team
Production of datasets on various types of indicators (ESG, Quant, NLP)


Main technologies requested: PySpark/Hadoop, AWS, Docker
A good level of English, very good interpersonal skills and strong motivation are required. The candidate must be able to demonstrate autonomy and curiosity in the face of a constantly changing environment.
The list of missions described is not necessarily exhaustive and is likely to be modified according to the constraints of the company and the evolution of its needs.
What do we expect from you?
Your training:
You hold a diploma from level BAC +2 to level BAC +5 (BTS at engineering school) with a specialization in computer science, software engineering or Data Science. We accept any type of profile, as long as you have significant experience in IT.
Your background:
You have at least 5 years of experience in Data Engineering;
You have a good understanding of different databases and data storage technologies;
You have solid knowledge of calculation distribution systems, such as Dask or PySpark;
You have a good knowledge of cloud computing systems, such as AWS or GCP;
You have a good command of Python;
You are fluent in English and French.
Even better :
You have knowledge of Machine Learning libraries;
You have a strong interest in Data Science and NLP;
You are autonomous, thoughtful, and you know how to be critical;
You have good communication skills and you know how to be honest.
What we offer at SESAMm
Package: We offer attractive packages and various advantages: restaurant voucher card, company mutual insurance.
Flexibility: We have signed a telework charter which will eventually allow us to telework up to three days a week and more with the COVID context.
Work environment: In our premises the watchword is conviviality, you will find something to regain your strength (coffee, tea, drinks, snacks) and to have exchanges in a rich and multicultural environment.
Career: Deciding to join SESAMm means having prospects for development, seeing the real impact of your daily work and contributing to the development of a hyper-growth start-up.
Professional development: We consider training to be a key point, both internally with our Learn & Show (workshops led by colleagues for knowledge sharing) or externally via organizations or platforms.
Transparency: You will always be aware of the evolution of the company, transparency is essential and regular information meetings: "Ask Me Anything" once a month (information meeting), strategic meetings...
Well-being: We have placed well-being at work and a corporate culture with strong values ​​at the heart of our concerns.
In summary, SESAMm is a strong team spirit, communication facilitated by a horizontal hierarchy and a culture rich in diversity.
Working conditions
Location: Paris
Type of contract: CDI
Working conditions Data Engineer (H/F) Télétravail in Paris (75) Development and maintenance of Big Data calculation algorithms with the rest of the team.
Production of datasets on various types of indicators (ESG, Quant, NLP)…

Kertios KERTIOS is a management and IT consulting firm, specializing in human capital management and the implementation of packaged applications. Our clients are international companies ready to transform their processes to achieve the best practices in their field. Our support is provided in all phases of their transformation, from strategy to implementation.
KERTIOS Consulting "Pluses":
Develop a triple skill: business, project and information system by evolving at the heart of complex and ambitious projects, accompanied by our expert senior consultants
Evolve within a company that demands the best from its employees while cultivating cohesion and team spirit
The Data Engineer participates in the development and optimization of the existing decision-making information system. He designs and implements platforms based on Big Data technologies.
If you want…
Work directly with the Business Departments (Sales, Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Risk, IT)
Support these departments in defining their Big Data exploitation strategy as well as in its operational implementation
Participate in large-scale transformation projects with high added value.
So why not you ?
Are you motivated and dynamic? Do you have excellent communication skills as well as a developed sense of service?
With a Bac+5 training, you have an IT engineer profile and have already carried out “Big Data” projects or missions participating in this major shift in the world of decision-making.
At ease in the use of new technologies (Hadoop ecosystem, Scala, Python, Shell, Linux, Unix) and having acquired very good knowledge of databases (SGBD like Oracle, PostGre, MySQL,… or NoSQL like Hive , Hbase, Impala, Cassandra, …), you are bursting with ideas and like to put them into practice.
Hadoop: ⭐⭐⭐
Database: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
Data prep: ⭐⭐⭐⭐
Do not hesitate, Join Us!

AXA Offer reference
22061649
Type of Contract
Alternation
level of experience
Students
Group companyAXA France
IT business family
Location
NANTERRE, Hauts-de-Seine

Your role and your missions
As part of its work-study campaign, AXA is recruiting a Data engineer (M/F) in work-study.
'The objective of this position is to examine in 2022 the files for the migration of data from "legacy" data warehouses (infocentre, DWH) to our technological target which is the Data Lake. Achieving this objective requires work on several aspects:
Mapping of the existing on these "legacy" warehouses.
Understanding the needs of business teams.
Understanding of the current uses of business teams.
Ability to project an optimal data model in a distributed architecture environment.
The work-study student must therefore be able to instruct the description of existing decision-making systems, in particular using data mining technologies (queries in databases), to understand the uses of the trades and their new needs, and to translate these needs into solution specification and design.
He must also be able to contribute to the development of a strategy and report to the authorities in place on the progress and the situation.
In 2023, the first implementation work will be done by different teams, the work-study student can either be integrated into one of his teams, or participate in the overall management of the project.
Your profile
You wish to carry out a work-study program within AXA and you are preparing a Bac+4 or Bac+5 with a specialty in Data science and/or computer engineering.

DESCRIPTION
About Morgan Stanley
Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values ​​rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethics. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Risk and Data Analytics Center, Paris
As we see increasing client interest in quantitative strategies, maintaining, and enhancing our leading position in risk analytics and technology is critical to our Institutional Securities Group (ISG) businesses globally. The seamless collaboration between technologists and ISG personnel, including data scientists, financial engineers and quantitative analysts helps to deliver innovative tools and solutions that differentiate us from our competitors.
Morgan Stanley is establishing a new Risk & Data Analytics (“R&D”) Center in Paris, where it will support our growth strategy for ISG both in EMEA and more broadly. The Center will deliver cutting-edge, proprietary solutions to address the rapidly changing business needs of our sales and trading franchise while providing a platform to foster innovation for our markets businesses, driven by analytical and technological excellence.

Technology at Morgan Stanley
Technology is the key differentiator that ensures that we manage our global businesses and serve clients on a market-leading platform that is resilient, safe, efficient, smart, fast and flexible. Technology redefines how we do business in global, complex and dynamic financial markets. We have a large number of award winning technology platforms that help to propel our Firm's businesses to be the top in the market. We have built strong techno-functional teams which partner with our offices globally taking global ownership of systems and products. We have a vibrant and diverse mix of technologists working on different technologies and functional domains. There is a broad focus on innovation, inclusion, giving back to the community and sharing knowledge.

This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art modern data stack using open-source technologies aligned with our cloud strategy. We are looking for a proficient developer who is excited about innovation, with a proven track record of delivery.
Roles and responsibilities include:
You will work closely with quants and traders on multiple trading desks to design, develop, deploy and support the innovative data science environment
Design widely used and flexible APIs to our core data and functionality
Analyze and optimize performance of large data workloads using compute clusters
Stay up to date with emerging trends and tools in the data & analytics domain
Provide support and design advice to users of the cross-asset platform
Work closely with strategists and other stakeholders to help move their financial assets, valuation models and data pipelines to the platform
Efficient Communication across regions and functions

Excellent problem solving and code development skills
Ability and interest to research, learn and implement new Data and Analytics technologies and paradigms
Enterprise level software development practices
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong team working ability in local and global teams
Passion for continuous improvement both personally and as a team

Safran Job Description
The democratization of the use of data in the aeronautical industry brings new problems in two main areas: production (Manufacturing data) and the operation of aircraft (Flight data). Whether it is the reduction of production costs for the first area or predictive maintenance for the second, projects using data science techniques are increasingly common and represent increasingly important issues.

In this context and within the Data division of Safran Engineering Services, your mission will consist in working jointly with Data Scientists, developers but also the business to deploy data pipelines comprising different processing bricks: ETL, Storage, algorithmic processing, visualization.

The projects in which you will take part will range from Proof Of Concept (POC) to the industrial solution through prototypes.
Job requirements
Scientific training: computer science, software development, mathematics / statistics, algorithms, physics,
Interest and motivation for industrial applications,
One or more experiences in an industrial field

You have the following skills:
Data architecture (Data modeling)
Design of the infrastructure / system architecture
Design and development of applications (software architecture)
Extraction, Transformation, Loading (ETL) of databases
Pipeline management
Testing
Data management (SQL and NoSQL)
Data security management
Algorithms, Coding
Software development
Statistics
Data Visualization - Exploration
Business knowledge and its industrial environment
Agile methodology and Cycle V

Your soft skills:
Motivated, autonomous, rigorous,
Adaptability, Curiosity
Strength of proposal, taking initiatives,
Analytical mind
Good communication skills,
Good communication,
Sense of customer service

Industrial experience in the field of transport and knowledge of Cloud architectures (public or private) would be a plus
Specificity of work
Occasional trips to France.

Safran is an international high-tech group operating in the fields of aeronautics (propulsion, equipment and interiors), space and defence. Its mission: to contribute sustainably to a safer world, where air transport is becoming ever more environmentally friendly, more comfortable and more accessible. Established on all continents, the Group employs 79,000 people for a turnover of 16.5 billion euros in 2020, and occupies, alone or in partnership, leading global or European positions in its markets. Safran engages in research and development programs that maintain the environmental priorities of its technological innovation roadmap.

Safran is ranked best global employer 2020 in its sector by Forbes magazine.

Safran Engineering Services offers high-tech engineering services in the fields of aeronautics, energy and ground transportation. With 30 years of experience, the company relies on 3,000 engineers in 9 countries around the world.

Your missions within our tribe

Gefco Chronotruck is a tech company that wants to transform the road transport of goods using algorithms and Data! In a nutshell: a web and mobile B2B platform for connecting shippers and geolocated professional carriers, which facilitates transactions between the two parties.

A pioneer in its field (even before the US!), Chronotruck is one of the French leaders in road freight 2.0. Acquired in 2019 by the transport giant GEFCO (https://www.gefco.net/fr/), the ambition from 2020 to 2022 is to become the European and then world leader in road freight transport.

Chronotruck has been selected as one of the 20 global companies that will revolutionize the road freight industry by Frost & Sullivan.
On the tech side, the team is made up of about ten people who work together to offer our users the best possible experience.

Our values: autonomy, involvement, rigour, desire to progress.

Allianz France Description of the mission

Allianz France, since 2016, has been developing capabilities in the field of Big Data and AI. This resulted in the creation of a dedicated department in 2018, bringing together employees of various profiles: Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Data Product Owners, Dev Web and more recently Data Science Product Leader.


The Big Data & AI Factory team is one of the 4 teams in this direction. This team has 4 agile scrums for a total of around 40 people and its areas of responsibility include:


Ensure the implementation of Data projects from the opportunity study (POC, POV) to production and follow-up in run
Implementation of AI projects with strong business impacts: predictive models, Computer Vision, NLP, Scoring, etc.
Assist the company's operational processes with AI and Big Data tools (5M acts assisted by AI in 2020)
Democratize access to Data (api & apps)
Fraud detection, analysis of emails, images, triggers, voice bots, etc.

The team is well established and now has such experience that it can manage a dozen projects in production while regularly delivering new ones!


Key Responsibilities

Within the Big Data & AI Factory team, under the responsibility of the Head of Data Science, you will have the role of Data Scientist (M/F).


As such, you will have the following responsibilities:


Ensure a role of expertise on the projects and data of the team by having a transverse vision to all the scrums;
Carry out data or Machine Learning studies to analyze new opportunities or respond to business requests by interacting directly with the business teams;
Lay the foundations for new projects (POC, POV);
Participate in the industrialization of projects or the improvement of existing projects;
Ensure a technological watch to offer ever more efficient tools and methods;
Support the skills development of other Data Scientists.


Profile / Skills

Let's talk about you:


Coming from a higher education in a related field (engineering, statistics, mathematics) and comfortable with statistical tools
5+ years of experience in the field of Data Science or Big Data
Work experiences in agile mode
Successful experiences in a similar field, particularly with a data project industrialization context
Expertise with data analysis and Big Data tools, including:

Languages: Python, pyspark, SQL
Databases: PostgreSQL, elasticsearch
Code management: Git, Gitlab, CI/CD
Job and pipeline management: Luigi (or equivalent)
Logs: prometheus, graphana

A business-oriented mindset and contribution of value for the business teams;
Rigorous to ensure a quality of deliverables and didactic to present the subjects to the trades
Professional use of English


The little extras:
A good knowledge of the insurance business


If you recognize yourself through this announcement, then do not hesitate to apply, we are waiting for you!

Ornikar About the Data team

The Data team at Ornikar has existed for more than 3 years and is made up of a dozen people (Data Analysts, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers).
We have mainly 3 missions:
Decision support: we support teams at all levels of management, whether for strategic objectives, product development, business, etc. We conduct complex analyzes to enable teams to make decisions based on figures that will enable us to achieve our objectives or identify new levers for growth.
Operational efficiency: The teams at Ornikar are very sensitive to data issues, which has enabled us to set up BI self-service on the one hand to allow them to carry out their quantitative research in complete autonomy, and to on the other hand, we respond to data flow automation issues to enrich their tools and speed up their daily lives.
The development of data features and algorithms to bring even more differentiating value to our products.
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer
In a process of long-term reflection on our products, we want to tackle our future competitive challenges now and seek differentiation through data, with the ambition of rising to the standards of insurTech and comparable scale-ups. in terms of innovation and best practices. Furthermore, as the Data team grows, the Data Science challenges develop. We have made our first proofs on research projects as well as in algorithms, it is time to confirm the test!
In this context, we are looking for our next Machine Learning Engineer. We are looking for a confirmed profile to help with the data development of Ornikar, in particular:
Participate in the construction of the Data roadmap, in particular in terms of innovation and medium-long term differentiation by Data, to meet growth ambitions.
Collect, analyze and understand the business needs entrusted to us by the Insurance teams (Marketing & Sales, Customer Experience & Claims) on Data Science and Machine Learning issues.
Design, plan, support and deliver machine learning projects that meet expectations (OCR, prediction, segmentation, etc.), knowing how to balance the challenges of feasibility, speed and business imperatives
Train, optimize, validate and deploy machine learning models, ensure their relevance, and monitor them (drifts, availability, performance, etc.)
Carry out monitoring work in order to keep our algorithms at the state of the art.
Maintain the code base of data science projects and develop Data Science industrialization processes at Ornikar (feature-store, etc.).
Work with the Data Engineering and Data Science Pricing teams to maintain a scalable architecture
Our stack: Fivetran, Mixpanel, Airflow, GCP including BigQuery, dbt, Metabase, dvc, docker, git & gitlab, fastAPI
Also, as the team is still in development, we remain very open to initiatives (tech / tools / etc.)! Joining us is the guarantee of working in a stimulating environment, of having an impact in the structuring of the team and its processes and of participating in the growth of a great project.
You are our ideal candidate if you...
You have at least 3 years of conclusive experience as Machine Learning on a modern Data stack, with a big plus if you have worked on OCR and classification issues, and on regression and time series models
You have already put into production and maintained Machine Learning models on a Cloud infrastructure, and you are able to maintain their relevance and availability.
You are proficient in Python and SQL
You are curious, enthusiastic, resourceful and you have a proactive approach
You like working in a team and communicating with audiences that are not necessarily technical
The recruitment process for this position
A first telephone conversation with Cassie, our Talent Acquisition Specialist
Interview with your future manager Thibault, Head of Data Operations on the Insurance side, to clarify the outlines of the position and the challenges of the team
A case study to prepare at home, then to restore around a videophone exchange of 1 hour to project you on missions of the post in real conditions
A cultural interview with the current members of the team to give you an overview of our rituals, methods, and to embark on our vision!


What Ornikar has to offer you…
Fixed compensation between €48k and €65k, depending on your level of impact and expertise observed during our interviews
The possibility of working remotely from anywhere in France

We are your ideal company if you are looking for…

ORTEC Time to apply what you have learned – ORTEC Junior Data Engineer
For this year and beyond, our Data Science & Consulting division (ODSC) has very ambitious plans to further improve the world [of our customers] using mathematics, data science and advanced analytics. To realize those plans, we need you as a Data Engineer! Being part of our Team means that you will be part of a mathematical and technical playground, outperforming in the field of Data Science, Data Engineering, Operations Research and Analytics, where smart minds grow into multi-talents.
Who we are
At ORTEC we know how to create value out of data using a proven approach and the latest tools and technologies. Since 1981 we improve business decisions by leveraging data and providing decision support models for many industry leading companies. No big studies and reports, but tangible, scalable and sustainable results. Our people are data-driven at heart and are eager to turn their broad expertise into concrete value. Making an impact by leveraging value out of the data is what makes ORTEC the go-to-company.
We are experienced in areas such as: Operations Management, Supply Chain Management, Marketing & Customer Interaction, Innovation, Sustainability and Organizational Development in markets like Retail, Energy, Transport, Post and Parcel and Manufacturing. This has led to valued strategic partnerships with parties such as FedEx / TNT, AirFrance-KLM, Total Energies, Shell, Air Liquide and Carrefour.
You as our new team member
During your first months at ORTEC, you will be given responsibility early on. You will get the opportunity to acquire more knowledge, to develop your passions, and to find out what kind of projects suit your ambitions.
In close collaboration with the client's project leads, technical leads and engineers, the ORTEC Data Engineering team build the data ingestion and processing pipelines. As a Junior Data Engineer, you work on projects like designing and building robust and complex data infrastructures for data analytics and machine learning purposes in the cloud. Projects subjects range from Internet-of-Things in supply chain, forecasting apps for production and customer demand, to creating a centralized data environment for the management of a large manufacturing organization.
Fully involved in our French team, serving our European customers, you mostly work on projects, in close connection with the technical and business representatives of our customers to better understand their needs and how ORTEC can help solving their challenges. Your work includes design, architecture, data quality, development and delivery of the various data driven apps and associated functionalities (e.g. visualization, data catalog, training).
As part of an international team, you'll have the opportunity to really make impact in your market(s) and have the benefits of a multi-disciplinary team by learning from each other and joining social activities.
Our hands-on training will give you the skills required for the various roles you will play. In terms of building your soft-skills, we also provide courses to improve your communication skills, to teach you how to work on projects more efficiently, to improve your time management, and to enlarge your commercial skills.
Join the team
Our team in Paris consists of around 20 people. You are coached on the job and supported to develop yourself by experienced consultants.
At ORTEC you will work with highly motivated colleagues with a passion for software and mathematics. We operate in a flat organizational structure that keeps communication lines short. The atmosphere is open, informal, collaborative, and fun.

Talend WHO WE ARE:

Talend, a leader in data integration and data governance, is changing the way the world makes decisions. In order to compete and win, IT and business leaders need data that they can trust and understand instantly. Talend Data Fabric is the only platform that seamlessly combines an extensive range of data integration and governance capabilities to actively manage the health of corporate information. This unified approach is unique and essential to delivering complete, clean, and uncompromised data in real-time to all employees. It has made it possible to create innovations like the Talend Trust Score™, an industry-first assessment that instantly quantifies the reliability of any data set.
Over 7,250 customers have chosen Talend to run their businesses on healthy data. Talend is recognized as a leader in its field by leading analyst firms and industry media.
We pride ourselves in our values ​​of Passion, Agility, Team Spirit, and Integrity. Every one of our 1,400 employees brings a certain je ne sais quoi that makes Talend special.

We are looking for an engaged and enthusiastic Data Engineer to join our brand new Telemetry Platform Team!
We make the pattern “You build it, you run it” a reality for the Products teams and make them more autonomous, allowing them to create better products and solve customer problems faster.

Reasons why we enjoy our work:
We care about our fellow engineers at Talend who are our internal users but also, equally important, we care about Talend’s customers.

This is not only about what we do, but mostly why and how. We discuss business needs, plan and work out solutions collectively, as a team. We also measure and value our impact on the company.

We design, setup develop and operate a reliable and robust central telemetry data service to develop internal data-driven analytics and smart customer facing applications - combining the innovative Data Lakehouse and Data mesh data platform concepts.
Teamwork is key and we enjoy solving problems together in pairs or as a whole team in an Agile approach.
How you will make an impact:
Build the brand new Telemetry Platform: You'll build a strong data science platform that will allow Talend teams (Data Engineering, Professional services, Customer success, Sales, Marketing, Product managers…) have a better understanding of the Talend Data Cloud Platform usage from its customers, and Data Scientists team to develop ML based services for the Talend Data Fabric.

Deliver best-in-class solutions: Work with top notch data technologies for Data ingestion, Data batch and streaming processing.Data governance, Data advanced analytics and ML solutions. Collaborate with Data Scientist/analysts to develop and deploy ML models and services and deliver relevant insights and dashboards

Be a team player: Support the data scientist and the business in delivering seamlessly solutions that will help to have a better understanding of our Cloud platform usage. Promote new technologies, methods and raise awareness around new technologies and innovations
We're looking for a teammate who is a:
Creative solution builder and passionate about Data Engineering! That includes experience in defining and evangelizing optimizations and best practices to build performing and scalable Data ingestion, processing, analytics/ML platforms

Experienced in Data engineering (we use state of the art open source data technologies such as the Apache Data ecosystem in a cloud native environment) and software development (Java, Python) as well as with automating cloud-based technologies, deploying applications

Which also means working knowledge of Cloud deployments (AWS/Azure) and Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes DevOps ecosystem).

Autonomous with strong interpersonal & communications skills, also familiar with Agile contexts.

For nearly 40 years, we've helped more than 1,200 organizations optimize their supply chains with solutions for transport operations optimization and management, loadout optimization, human resources planning, demand forecasting and deliveries and many more. We make our clients' businesses more efficient, predictable and successful by turning complex challenges into easy-to-use solutions.
ORTEC has approximately 1,000 employees worldwide and has offices in 13 countries. Our main office in France is in Paris 2nd. From our French offices, we support companies of all sizes (from the CAC40 to regional companies) in various sectors such as energy, retail, industry, logistics. We also work with our international clients by regularly supporting our other European and American offices.

ORTEC's culture is open and informal, designed to promote collaboration and provide meaningful care and responsibility throughout your career.

Description of the mission
The candidate will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. He/She will work in close collaboration with architecture and feature teams on data initiatives and will ensure an optimal and consistent data delivery process. He/She will also have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.

He/She will be responsible for:
design data models;
building, developing and testing ELT / ETL processes;
assembles large, complex data sets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements
processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
writing and refactoring the code into reusable libraries, APIs, and tools in order to have clear, efficient, tested, and high-quality code;
playing an active role in pursuing engineering excellence, by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary;
Supporting business analytics cross-department initiatives;

He/She will become an expert in big data solutions. Depending on the initiative, he/she may need to investigate new relevant technologies and to test the most promising ones.

Ubisoft Company Description

Ubisoft teams have 21,000 people spread over more than 40 sites around the world and are linked by a common mission: to enrich the lives of players through original and memorable gaming experiences. Their energy and talent have helped bring to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer and believes that diversity of backgrounds and perspectives is essential to creating worlds that allow everyone to thrive and express themselves. If you're excited to take on exciting challenges, harness cutting-edge technologies, and take part in the future of entertainment, join us and create the unknown.

Job Description

For several years, Ubisoft has set up teams and tools dedicated to data in order to improve the experience of its games and the management of its activities. The company took a new step in 2019 by creating the Data Office, a global team reporting directly to the CEO whose mission is to make data a strategic asset for the company. To achieve this objective, the department aims to improve the pooling, sharing and use of data initiatives within the group.
We are therefore currently looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join the Data Architecture team where his main mission will be to lead Data Quality projects. Working in close collaboration with all Ubisoft Data Office teams, he will have to design, enrich and develop new transversal tools.
Your main tasks will be to:
Monitor and improve data quality within Ubisoft Data Office;
Participate in the design / development / and maintenance of data quality tools within Ubisoft Data Office:
1. Data quality framework;
2.ETL framework;
3. Migration tool;
4.Customer Support API.
Facilitate Agile ceremonies;
Collaborate with project teams for the development of new features and bug fixes;
Provide support on data quality tools;
Stay abreast of technological advances to help develop our best practices

Qualifications

Background
Significant experience (minimum 4 years) in data engineering is required for the position, ideally with knowledge of Quality Control or Data Quality Management.
Required Skills
Mastery of SQL languages ​​(knowing Snowflake is a plus) & Python.
Good knowledge of the Linux environment.
Strong critical thinking, communication and interpersonal skills.
Fluent English.
Bonus Skills:
Skills in web development (front-end).
Knowledge of major DevOps principles (CI / CD, automation & configuration, etc.).
Experience with big data technologies (eg Kafka, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc).

Additional Information

Recruitment process
[30 minutes]: Phone conversation with a Recruiter
[60 minutes]: Interview (video) with the job manager and a Recruiter
[60 minutes]: Technical interview with the workstation manager and a member of the Data Architecture teams

Benefits at Ubisoft
Incentive and participation, company savings plan. In addition: 25 CP, 12 RTT, 50% of the Navigo pass covered, restaurant tickets, good mutual insurance, and lots of Ubisoft advantages.
Our new premises are in Saint Mandé (line 1, Saint Mandé stop), gym on the premises.

BNP Paribas Data Engineer M/F

Concretely your daily life?
This position will consist of providing STFS with the data necessary for credit stress tests.
As a Data Engineer, you will understand the necessary requirements for performing the various stress test exercises. You will participate in the formulation of the request/need specification, collect the data, process it, analyze it and structure it.
This will require functional knowledge of credit and specific business needs of the STFS Modeling Team (STMM).
The database resulting from this work will be provided to STMM and the stress test engine in order to be able to carry out projections of weighted assets and the cost of risk, dependent on macroeconomic scenarios.


This work will require a good level of communication and a very good capacity for teamwork, within STFS on the one hand and with the business lines (domestic markets, CIB, PF, IRB) and group functions (RISK and FINANCE) on the other hand.
Data is at the heart of the need for credit stress tests. In an ever more demanding regulatory environment, our ability to prepare it and return it in short times, with optimal quality, are key.
The work environment is important!
BNP PARIBAS Group Finance, RISK and ALM Treasury have set up a JV team in charge of Group stress testing, financial planning and financial synthesis called STFS for Stress Testing and Financial Synthesis.
Within the STFS platform, Stress Testing and Data Analytics (STDA), is responsible for providing the data needed to perform internal and regulatory stress test exercises on all of the group's material risks (credit, securitization, banking book market risk, etc.). STDA is also responsible for certain regulatory reporting in which STFS is involved.
The team is made up of functional experts in order to understand and formalize the need for data, but also technical experts in order to structure, control and develop solutions for making this data available. On credit, engine databases are made available to the group stress test engine to provide risk-weighted asset and cost of risk projections. STDA is one of the main users of the group's stress testing platform (PROMETHEE).
The position is based at Millénaire 1, Paris 19th. You will be able to telecommute up to 2.5 days a week.
And after ?
This cross-functional position offers many opportunities to work with players in many regions and to apprehend and understand the different businesses within the Group.
And the pay?
We will know how to value your talent. Let's discuss it!
Why BNP Paribas?
Our world is changing: our way of informing ourselves, of consuming… and of working too! Today, what counts in a job is to live real experiences, to learn, to share objectives and results with colleagues.

In short, to chart your own path, different, responsible and sustainable.
At BNP Paribas, we recruit our employees with the idea that they will help us design the world and the bank of tomorrow.
Want to know all the reasons to join us? Go to www.bnpparibas.com
And you?
You are a graduate of a Bac+5 and you have at least 5 years' experience as a data analyst in risk/finance. You are proficient in SQL and Python.
Your level of English is advanced both orally and in writing.
You have developed good abilities to collaborate and communicate.
Your rigor, your analytical skills combined with your organizational skills will be assets to succeed in this position.
In a changing world, diversity, equity and inclusion are key values ​​for the well-being and performance of teams.
At BNP Paribas, we want to welcome and retain all talents without distinction: this is how we will build, together, the finance of tomorrow, innovative, responsible and sustainable.


Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act on a daily basis with ethical and professional responsibility.

Creating a bond of trust with its customers, it gives them the means to analyze their innumerable data. Combining high-level technical expertise and unlimited creativity, it develops personalized approaches intended to enhance the organization's data.

Job description:
You will be required to work on various innovative projects, for clients of all sizes, in various and varied sectors such as agri-food, trade, distribution, banking, finance, luxury, energy , industry, pharma/chemistry or health.
As a passionate Data Engineer, you will help our customers meet the challenges of today and tomorrow by integrating their data into infrastructures, On-Premise and Cloud. Safran is an international high-tech group operating in the fields of aeronautics (propulsion, equipment and interiors), space and defence. Its mission: to contribute sustainably to a safer world, where air transport is becoming ever more environmentally friendly, more comfortable and more accessible. Established on all continents, the Group employs 79,000 people for a turnover of 16.5 billion euros in 2020, and occupies, alone or in partnership, leading global or European positions in its markets. Safran engages in research and development programs that maintain the environmental priorities of its technological innovation roadmap.

Safran is ranked best global employer 2020 in its sector by Forbes magazine.

Safran Aircraft Engines designs, produces and markets, alone or in cooperation, civil and military aircraft engines with the highest levels of performance. The company is notably, through CFM International*, the world leader in the propulsion of short and medium-haul commercial aircraft. In the field of military propulsion, the company has fully designed, developed and produced the M88 and the M53 which respectively equip the Rafale and the Mirage 2000 and will be the engine integrator for the future European combat aircraft.

CFM International is a 50/50 joint company of Safran Aircraft Engines and GE.

About the job
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. Margo Conseil Our mission at Margo? Accelerate the digital transformation of our customers by supporting them in the deployment of complex IT projects.

We are a human-sized consulting firm whose objective for 15 years has been to ensure the satisfaction of our consultants as well as that of our clients. The recipe for this is simple: we carefully select our projects so that each of our employees feels stimulated and progresses quickly. This is why we have developed expertise in sectors of activity where there are strong technical constraints: multithreading, real time, performance, data volume, etc. Our consultants work with prestigious clients in market finance, insurance or energy, in large groups or successful startups.

The Margo adventure also means joining a community of 350 experts, all passionate about tech, spread between Paris, London and Warsaw. By their side, you will be able to evolve quickly and develop new skills. Ready to join us?

Example of a project proposed by Margo:

By integrating Margo, you will have the choice of the missions on which you wish to work. You will be supported by our team of Business Managers, whose role is to find the client project that best meets your expectations.
Thus, for example, you will be able to work on one of our projects to redesign from scratch a data lake within a major player in Asset Management.
The objective is to ensure the distribution of data in the optimized way to create a distribution layer and allow Data Scientists to implement use cases.
You will thus have the opportunity to evolve in a demanding environment, in agile methodology and within a team of experts, made up of 4 Spark / Scala developers, 1 data architect, 1 Ops and 1 tech lead.

As a Data Engineer, your missions will be:
Develop in agile mode the business uses based on the Datalake Hadoop
Identify and model data necessary for use
Select the most suitable storage for use among the technologies of the Hadoop ecosystem
Develop data transformation and production processing in Spark and Scala
Development of RESTful API (Scala / Play) allowing access to the data produced
Participate in continuous improvement and code refactoring

Tech stack:
Hadoop/Cloudera
Spark / Scala / Python / Java
Azure cloud
Impala / Hbase

Internal life at Margo

The projects we offer at Margo are long assignments (2 to 3 years) that will allow you to progress towards technical expertise.

You will also have the opportunity to get involved in the internal life of Margo and contribute to the growth of our community. The possibilities are numerous, you can become:

Recruiter, to technically test candidates during their recruitment process, represent Margo at school forums or propose co-optations of people from your network.
Trainer, to share your expertise and knowledge within the Margo community.
Manager, to follow on assignment and guarantee the career development of junior consultants.
Editor, to highlight your expertise and that of Margo by writing technical articles published on our blog and in the specialized press.

You are a future Margo if:

Must-Have
You come from an engineering school or an equivalent university course at Bac + 5 / Master's level.
You like to code and you are passionate about IT.
You are curious and you are interested in the latest technologies on the market.
You have a first experience as a Data Engineer.

Nice to Have
You are ambitious and not afraid to work on challenging projects in environments with strong technical constraints (high volume of data, real time, performance optimization). You ideally master multithreading.
You like working in a team and are committed to respecting good code practices.
You speak and understand English.

Our recruitment process:
Throughout the recruitment process, you have the opportunity to participate in events organized by Margo and to exchange with collaborators in order to learn more about us!
PS: If you study or work away from Paris, we suggest that you follow this process in full video via Google's Hangout Meets system. CleverConnect Company Description

Created by engineers, CleverConnect is a fast-growing HRtech player (+50% growth). We strive to provide millions of candidates with the right job. To do this, we connect recruiters and candidates with innovative solutions and platforms to make the recruitment process more efficient.
What are our solutions and platforms?
A pioneer in recruitment matching technologies (HRMatch), we offer candidates specific job offers on our clients' career sites (in 22 languages). Meteojob.com, one of the main French job sites, also relies on this technology.
Visiotalent, allows candidates to showcase their personality and general skills beyond their CV, thanks to short videos shared with recruiters.
Our Smart Career Websites are fully customizable, high-performance platforms to attract candidates and allow recruiters to better assess their soft skills.
Beyond our successes in France, we are developing our presence in Europe! We are already present in Spain and Italy, and we will soon be present in Germany.
Today we support nearly 10 million candidates in France and Europe

Job Description

To support our strong growth, we are looking for Data Scientists to join our talented teams who share a common passion for distributed services, scalability and continuous development.
As part of our dynamic Tech team, you are in charge of designing, developing, delivering and maintaining our platform. You contribute to the creation and deployment of robust, high-performance and high-availability services.
More precisely:
You collaborate within a Data team with the Product Manager, Data Engineer and Software Engineers to design and build data processing solutions that meet the needs of our customers.
You transform raw data into insightful analyzes characterized by excellent governance, transparency on the techniques used and clear documentation.
You design and build distributed data processing services based on Data Science such as NLP.
You establish models using Machine Learning algorithms to simplify the search for the candidate as well as that of the recruiter.
Thanks to your mastery of data science, you identify opportunities to improve the platform and support our customers through the application in their decision-making.
You design and analyze rigorous experiments, help teams define relevant hypotheses and deliver solid analyzes of the results obtained.
You identify the metrics actionable by our customers. You then develop dashboards and reports to monitor and anticipate activity.

Qualifications

You are a results-oriented data scientist with proven experience in data analysis, NLP and predictive modeling.
Specifically, as a Data Scientist ‍‍:
You are proficient in Python and SQL
You master the Scikit, Numpy, Pytorch, Pandas libraries…
You have experience with Machine Learning methods and frameworks such as Tensorflow and their implementation
You are familiar with development practices such as version control (git), testing frameworks, code review and CI/CD.
You have an excellent command of databases, schema design and optimization techniques as well as a good knowledge of NoSQL Databases.
You are familiar with the AWS or GCP Cloud ecosystem.
You have experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau or other.
You have an analytical mind that enjoys solving complex problems.
You are rigorous and pay great attention to detail.
You are looking for efficiency and automation of your tasks.
You have a bac+5 in Computer Science and Mathematics.
You have a good command of English
We create within CleverConnect & Talentry, solutions intended to offer fulfilling jobs for all and to connect people with organizations they love. We are fully committed to treating our candidates, colleagues and partners equally, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, physical appearance, disability or any other protected characteristic. by the law.
